VOLUSIA COUNTY'S GENERAL NOTES:
SIGNALS:
1.
BLACK POLYCARBONATE HOUSINGS ARE REQUIRED FOR VEHICULAR SIGNAL HEAD ASSEMBLIES IN VOLUSIA COUNTY. ALL
VEHICLE SIGNAL DISPLAYS SHALL BE LED. ALL SIGNAL HEADS SHALL INCLUDE TUNNEL VISORS, BACKPLATES WITH
REFLECTIVE BORDERS. SPANWIRE SHALL BE LIGHTWEIGHTS TOP SECTION (RED) ALUMINUM, MAST ARMS SHALL BE
(YELLOW/GREEN) POLYCARBONATE SECTIONS.
2.
THE CONTRACTOR SHALL NOTIFY THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT TO HAVE THE EXISTING TAG READER REMOVED PRIOR TO
THE REMOVAL OF THE EXISTING STRAIN POLES AND REINSTALLED AFTER THE COMPLETION OF THE PROJECT.
1.
THE CONTRACTOR SHALL NOTIFY VOLUSIA COUNTY TRAFFIC ENGINEERING AT LEAST (2) TWO BUSINESS DAYS PRIOR
TO BEGINNING WORK. NOTIFY ALLEN CATES AND TIM KARR (386) 736-5968.
2.
THE CONTRACTOR SHALL COORDINATE WORK SCHEDULE, COORDINATE TIMING AND AUTHORIZATION OF POWER
SERVICE WITH VOLUSIA COUNTY TRAFFIC ENGINEERING. NOTIFY ALLEN CATES, TIM KARR, AND KARL EWALD (386)
736-5968.
3.
ANY ITEM NOT SPECIFICALLY ADDRESSED IN THESE PLANS, USE F.D.O.T. F.Y. 2024-25 STANDARD PLANS AND
JANUARY 2023 SPECIFICATIONS. ALL MATERIALS AND HARDWARE SHALL BE PRE-APPROVED BY VOLUSIA COUNTY
TRAFFIC ENGINEERING.
4.
UNLESS OTHERWISE NOTED, ALL REMOVED EQUIPMENT SHALL BE DELIVERED TO VOLUSIA COUNTY TRAFFIC
OPERATIONS, 3771 W. INTERNATIONAL SPEEDWAY, DAYTONA BEACH FL, 32124, EXCEPT CONCRETE POLES, WHICH
SHALL BE DISPOSED OF BY THE CONTRACTOR IN AREAS PROVIDED BY HIM.
5.
THE CONTRACTOR SHALL VERIFY COLOR CODES FOR SIGNAL CABLE WITH VOLUSIA COUNTY TRAFFIC ENGINEERING
BEFORE ORDERING.
6.
EXISTING SIGNALIZATION SHALL REMAIN IN PLACE TO THE EXTENT POSSIBLE AND SHALL BE USED FOR
MAINTENANCE OF TRAFFIC AS REQUIRED. THE MAINTENANCE OF EXISTING SIGNALS, UNTIL REMOVED, SHALL REMAIN
THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE CONTRACTOR.
7.
